channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: I covered the Rodney King and Freddie Gray riots. This moment feels different. That's why I'm afraid
item.description: The activist with the salt and pepper goatee who stood before me couldn't contain his euphoria.

item.title: Trump defiant as cultural change sweeps America
Brianna Keilar: You are watching America's reckoning
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar outlines some major cultural shifts the US is seeing in the wake of the death of George Floyd while in Minneapolis police custody.

item.title: English Premier League players to wear Black Lives Matter instead of their names on jerseys
Officer charged with killing Floyd still eligible for pension worth more than $1M
item.description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin could receive more than $1 million in pension benefits during his retirement years even if he is convicted of killing George Floyd.

item.title: Don Lemon reacts to comedian calling him out in Netflix special
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon reacts to Dave Chappelle mentioning him in his Netflix special after Lemon called for celebrities to use their platforms to speak out about the death of George Floyd.

item.title: New Melania book says she renegotiated her prenuptial agreement
item.description: Part of the reason first lady Melania Trump delayed her move from New York City to the White House in 2017 was because she was renegotiating her prenuptial agreement with President Donald Trump, according to a book out next week by a Washington Post reporter.

item.title: If he loses, the next Donald Trump could be ... Donald Trump
Poland invaded the Czech Republic last month, but says it was just a big misunderstanding
item.description: The Polish military has admitted it accidentally invaded the Czech Republic last month, but it insists its brief occupation of a small part of the country was simply a "misunderstanding."

item.title: Coronavirus deaths in this capital city could exceed its wartime fatalities
Trump economic adviser claims there 'is no second wave'
More US cities and states are sounding the alarm over spikes in cases
US soccer star slams Trump: 'You're supposed to help ... not throw oil onto the fire'
Black man pardoned '100 years overdue' in rape case that led to lynchings
item.description: The Minnesota Board of Pardons posthumously pardoned Max Mason by unanimous vote Friday, 100 years after he was accused in a rape case that led to three other black men being lynched.

item.title: A wild, pro-Trump conspiracy theory group is about to get its first congresswoman
item.description: The Republican primary in Georgia's 14th district on Tuesday didn't draw much national attention. After all, it's an overwhelmingly Republican district that GOP Rep. Tom Graves had held easily for a decade in Congress before announcing his retirement last year.

item.title: Young Americans are having less sex than ever
item.description: Young Americans are having less sex -- and they can't even blame the coronavirus pandemic for this one.

item.title: John Bolton's book to be published later this month despite White House objections
item.description: President Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton will publish his long-awaited memoir later this month over objections of the White House, Bolton's publisher said Friday.

item.title: Justice Department to release less-redacted version of the Mueller Report
item.description: The Justice Department says it will release a less-redacted version of the Mueller Report no later than next Friday, after being pressed for it in court.

item.title: Starbucks reverses stance on Black Lives Matter apparel
item.description: Starbucks has reversed its prohibition on employees wearing Black Lives Matter apparel. CNN's Cristina Alesci explains why.

item.title: Ford recalls 2 million vehicles because the doors could open while driving
item.description: Ford is recalling more than 2 million vehicles in the US because the doors could open while the vehicle is being driven.

item.title: Tabloid accused of glorifying domestic abuse after front-page interview with J.K. Rowling's ex-husband
item.description: Britain's biggest-selling tabloid newspaper, The Sun, has been accused of glorifying domestic violence, after it ran an interview with the ex-husband of author J.K. Rowling on its front page under the headline: "I slapped JK and I'm not sorry."

item.title: Archaeologist gets jail sentence for faking his finds
item.description: A Spanish archaeologist has been sentenced to more than two years in prison and fined €12,490 (over $14,000) for forging some of his most famous findings.

item.title: Astronomers witness the steadfast beating heart of a black hole
item.description: About 600 million light-years away from Earth, the heartbeat of a supermassive black hole can be seen emanating from the center of a galaxy.

item.title: This lake just turned pink and experts don't know exactly why
item.description: What caused the lake to turn pink?

item.title: Images show how coronavirus is overrunning Rio's hospitals
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports from Rio de Janeiro where coronavirus is overwhelming the hospitals and healthcare workers as Brazil nears the peak of its curve.

item.title: State of emergency declared on rape and gender violence in Nigeria
item.description: State governors in Nigeria have declared a state of emergency on rape following a spate of sexual violence against young women in the nation.

item.title: Death of black female essential worker at center of British BLM movement
item.description: Protesters across the UK are chanting for George Floyd as well Belly Mujinga, a black essential worker who died of Covid-19. Galvanized by the Black Lives Matter movement, her case has prompted more people in the UK to call for social justice. CNN's Salma Abdelaziz reports.

item.title: Elon Musk's tunnel project hit a milestone. But the future is unclear.
item.description: Three years ago, Elon Musk pitched a grandiose vision for the future of intracity vehicle travel: layers of tunnels that would efficiently speed vehicles through cities. Drivers would maneuver their own Teslas to street-level elevators, which would lower them to be whisked away on autonomous electric sleds at speeds up to 120 mph. Pedestrians and cyclists would ride in an autonomous electric vehicle that resembled a glass-plated train car.

item.title: Dave Chappelle drops hard-hitting '8:46' special
item.description: Dave Chappelle dropped a surprise special Thursday night in which he searingly addresses the death of George Floyd and the aftermath.

item.title: She wasn't invited to Trump's meeting in her city. Hear what she has to say about it
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks with Dallas County Sheriff Marian Brown. Brown was one of three key black law enforcement officials in the Dallas area who was not invited to attend an event with President Donald Trump that was promoted as discussing "justice disparities."

item.title: NBA player reveals he was sexually abused at a young age
item.description: Lonnie Walker IV of the San Antonio Spurs had been growing out his hair since the 5th grade until he recently got it cut. But that haircut comes with a sad, shocking back story.

item.title: Prime Minister apologizes for saying there was 'no slavery' in Australia
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has apologized for saying earlier this week that there was "no slavery" in Australia, after his comments provoked outrage and accusations that he was ignoring the country's history of forced labor.

item.title: Sajid Javid: Racism wasn't born on the streets of America
item.description: Former UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid says the death of George Floyd has rightly provoked soul searching in the UK too and the government must act to tackle racism

item.title: Airport offers 'pretend to go abroad' airport tours amid pandemic
item.description: With planes grounded and most tourism on hold during the coronavirus pandemic, one Taiwanese airport has come up with a unique solution to help citizens get their travel fix.

item.title: He spent over $1M on drugs before getting sober. Today, DJ Fat Tony still provides the soundtrack to London's party scene
item.description: One of the last parties that DJ Fat Tony played was Brooklyn Beckham's 21st birthday, held in a giant glass marquee at David and Victoria Beckham's family home in the English countryside. After that, he performed at legendary London venue Ministry of Sound. Then, the city went into lockdown.

item.title: 'Jaws,' the ultimate summer movie, meets the age of coronavirus
item.description: Remember the mayor in "Jaws," coaxing that family to go in the water, before they grab their raft and tentatively wade into the ocean? That image -- introduced 45 years ago this month -- keeps coming to mind as entertainment options, including movie theaters, gradually reopen in the age of coronavirus.

item.title: White celebrities take part in antiracism PSA; fans react
item.description: A group of white celebrities participated in a PSA vowing to "Take Responsibility" against racism. The video got mixed reactions on social media.

item.title: Listen to these artists for Black Music Month
item.description: June is Black Music Month and with all that's happening in our culture, the timing feels particularly strong.

item.title: Sedentary lockdowns put kids at risk for obesity. Here's how to help them stay moving
item.description: Canceled soccer practices. Shuttered dance rehearsals.

item.title: Luxury quarantining: Inside the Wyoming resort renting for $175,000 a week
item.description: Wyoming, with a population density of six people per square mile, may never have been more appealing as a vacation destination as it is now.

item.title: Quarantined cruise ship employee creates incredible outfits out of paper bags
item.description: Australian dancer Ashleigh Perrie was thrilled to start working on board the MS Zaandam. The cruise ship was due to travel through Antarctica -- past penguins and sea lions -- and onward to South America, while Perrie spent her days doing what she loved: performing.

item.title: Rescuers rush to sinking boat with nine people aboard
item.description: Rescuers saved nine people when a boat started to sink off the Florida coast.

item.title: Remember when the Beckhams went everywhere in matching outfits?
item.description: London's first digital fashion week kicks off today, offering an ideal opportunity to reflect on where British fashion is going -- and how far it has come.

item.title: As Trump loses his generals, he clings to the legacy of Confederate failure
item.description: It's head-scratching, really, that the most prominent Army base in America is named for Braxton Bragg.

item.title: White House didn't get heads up about top general's apology
item.description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs Gen. Mark Milley did not give the White House a heads up before he released a recorded video on Thursday admitting it was a "mistake" to appear in a photo-op last week with President Donald Trump, three administration officials told CNN.

item.title: Cuomo: Proof of systemic racism is in Trump's cabinet
item.description: Director of the United States National Economic Council, Larry Kudlow denied the existence of systemic racism in the US when asked by a reporter. CNN's Chris Cuomo uses data to prove Kudlow wrong.

item.title: US soccer star slams Trump: 'You're supposed to help ... not throw oil onto the fire'
item.description: U.S. Men's National Team midfielder Weston McKennie says he doesn't think President Donald Trump is "... the right president for this time" to address what has unfolded in the wake George Floyd's death.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths in this city could exceed its wartime toll
item.description: • LIVE UPDATES: India overtakes UK to become fourth worst affected country from Covid-19 • Nurse leader accuses Brazil of sacrificing medics to coronavirus • New cases delay school reopening in Beijing • What to know about coronavirus today

item.title: Reality has caught up with stocks
item.description: Thursday was the worst day for stocks since March as investors woke up to the risks of another wave of coronavirus infections and the devastating impact that would have on an already cratering economy.

item.title: Britain delays border controls to soften Brexit blow to its crashing economy
item.description: The United Kingdom will delay the introduction of border checks on imports from the European Union by as much as six months in a bid to avoid piling on the pain for British business and choking off vital food supplies.
